One dead in two-car smash Date January 26, 2009 Read later
Britt Smith
Tweet Pin It Email article Print
The scene of this morning's crash at Frankston in which one man was killed. Photo: Angela Wylie
A man died and four young males were injured - two seriously - when an early morning fishing trip turned to tragedy in Frankston this morning.
Police say four mates were driving to Frankston to go fishing when the sedan they were in was in a collision with another car at traffic lights at the intersection of Ferndale Drive and Cranbourne Road about 6.40am.
Both drivers were trapped for 45 minutes. The 23-year-old driver of the sedan died at the scene. His passengers, 16, 17 and 18, all from Cranbourne, were injured.
View Larger Map The driver of the second vehicle, a 24-year-old from South Morang, suffered upper-body injuries and was flown to The Alfred hospital where he was in a stable condition.
Advertisement Police closed the intersection and diverted traffic.
Ambulance Victoria spokesman Ray Rowe said two of the injured - the 16-year-old and the 24-year-old - were taken to The Alfred hospital and others to Royal Melbourne Hospital.
A witness described the aftermath of the crash as "chaotic''.
"There were two cars and both were badly damaged, totally crumpled,'' said Karen Gill, manager of a nearby fast-food restaurant.
"It looked pretty serious, there were police everywhere and they are still out there now.''
Frankston police Sergeant Bruce Buchan said the men in the sedan were driving to Frankston to go fishing.
